messages.title: Passengers stranded as buses cut
messages.content: Labour would protect bus passes for pensioners and introduce a new bus fare for under 25s.

messages.title: More police needed on our streets
messages.content: Police numbers are down and crime is on the rise under the Tory Government. Labour's fully costed plan will put 10,000 police back on the beat.

messages.title: Tories cutting school kitchen staff hours
messages.content: The Conservative County Council is trying to cut the hours of kitchen staff in our schools. Catherine is standing side by side with school kitchen staff and families who understand the importance of decent school dinners.

messages.title: It's time for change
messages.content: Erewash needs an MP who will stand up for local people.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Labour proposes to protect bus passes for pensioners and introduce a new bus fare for under 25s to address the bus service cuts.
Labour aims to tackle the decline in police numbers and the rise in crime by putting 10,000 police back on the beat.
Labour opposes the Conservative County Council's plans to cut kitchen staff hours in schools and supports the provision of quality school dinners.
Catherine Atkinson and local figures are speaking against HS2 and the damage it is predicted to do to Erewash, advocating to stop the expansion of the project.

issues.education: Opposes the Conservative Council's move to cut school kitchen staff hours.
issues.environment: Speaks against the damage HS2 will do to Erewash.
issues.governance: Critical of the Conservative government's policies on buses and policing.

leaflet.personalStatement: Catherine Atkinson is fighting for you.

quotes.text: It's time for change. Erewash needs an MP who will stand up for local people.

images.caption: Catherine Atkinson with James Dawson speaking against HS2.
Catherine Atkinson stands with school kitchen staff.

leaflet.additionalNotes: Leaflet discusses a local campaign against HS2 and criticizes the incumbent Conservative representation for various perceived failings.
